channel.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
channel.description:
I posted this is client help section but for some reason no one ever goes there.
Hey, Basically my torva, pernix and virtus loads like this:
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/aue4y9.png[/img]
When it should load like this:
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/35d9e87.png[/img]
How do I get it to load this the second picture please help.

item.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Mr Rushed:

fridder have u fixed ur models yet?

Yeah.

        itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396;
        itemDef.modelRotation2 = 5;

For the fullbody thing, yeah. playerLegs, not too sure. Look around that class for more things that declare legs and bodies.

Read full topic
item.source: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong

item.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Rushed Mr Rushed
item.description:
@Mr_Rushed wrote:

Well, Im going to try fix this fridder have u fixed ur models yet?

Am I doing it correct? Look

private static String[] fullbody = { "top", "chestplate", "shirt","platebody","Ahrims robetop", "White platebody", "Elite void knight top", "Karils leathertop","brassard","Robe top","robetop", "Vesta's chainbody", "platebody (t)","platebody (g)","chestplate", "Lord Marshal Top", "Primal platebody", "torso", "hauberk", "Dragon chainbody", "blouse", "jacket", "chainbody", "Chainbody", "leather body", "Leather Body", "Torva platebody", };

public static boolean playerLegs(int itemId) { String[] data = { "tassets", "chaps", "bottoms", "gown", "trousers", "MarshBot", "platelegs", "robe", "plateskirt", "legs", "leggings", "Proselyte Tasset", "Proselyte tasset", "shorts", "Skirt", "skirt", "Torva platelegs", "cuisse", "Pantaloons", "Trousers", "Lord Marshal Trousers", "Elite void knight top", };

Read full topic

item.description:
@wolvesyoungy wrote:

[code]switch (itemDef.id) {
case 13362:

break;

		case 2:

item.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Mr Rushed, post:52, topic:422725”]Torva_platebody
Torva_platelegs[/quote]

Under the full body section, put Torva platebody and for the platelegs put Torva platelegs. Search in that class for ‘torva platebody’ to see if its under platelegs for some reason, then search for the ID. If the ID comes up, post the chunk of code around it.

Read full topic

[quote=“Fridder, post:45, topic:422725”]Item.java, search for private static String[] fullmask = {
Add “Torva full helm” to the list and make sure its named ‘Torva_full_helm’ in Item.cfg.[/quote]

item.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Rushed Mr Rushed
item.description:
@Mr_Rushed wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:39, topic:422725”]itemDef.modelRotation2 = 5;
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396;

That’s about as good as they’re going to get.

As for this problem:

Open Model.java and replace public Model with:

public Model(int modelId) { byte[] is = aClass21Array1661[modelId].aByteArray368; if (is[is.length - 1] == -1 && is[is.length - 2] == -1) read622Model(is, modelId); else readOldModel(modelId); if (newmodel[modelId]) { scale2(4);// 2 is too big -- 3 is almost right if(anIntArray1638 != null) { for(int j = 0; j < anIntArray1638.length; j++) anIntArray1638[j] = 10; } } }[/quote]

W00T fixed but the helmet is ****** in the head guess I won’t put it in the shops till I get a fix and for the torva equipping in the wrong place help what I add there?

Read full topic
item.source: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong

item.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Or, add

    if(anIntArray1638 != null) {
    for(int j = 0; j < anIntArray1638.length; j++)
          anIntArray1638[j] = 10;
         }

Under [tt]scale2(4);

Read full topic
item.source: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong

item.title: Torva, Pernix And Virtus Loading Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

			itemDef.modelRotation2 = 5;
			itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396;

That’s about as good as they’re going to get.

As for this problem:

Open Model.java and replace public Model with:

public Model(int modelId) { byte[] is = aClass21Array1661[modelId].aByteArray368; if (is[is.length - 1] == -1 && is[is.length - 2] == -1) read622Model(is, modelId); else readOldModel(modelId); if (newmodel[modelId]) { scale2(4);// 2 is too big -- 3 is almost right if(anIntArray1638 != null) { for(int j = 0; j < anIntArray1638.length; j++) anIntArray1638[j] = 10; } } }

Read full topic

			itemDef.modelID = 62714;
